185962848.review:
The fact that this game isn't more popular is a grave injustice. The world is dark and enticing, the gameplay is on point, and the build variety rivals that of Path of Exile. Want to dual-wield pistols while leading an army of skeletons? Melt your enemies with a magic Kamehameha made of otherworldly fire? Throw grenades, mines and, occasionally, your shield? All of these and more are possible in Grim Dawn.

At the time of writing this review, the game has been out for almost 9 years and has been receiving patches, balance fixes, and content expansions throughout this time. Right now, we're awaiting the release of Fangs of Asterkarn, the next DLC expanding the world and gameplay variety even more.

Grim Dawn is an excellent game and I cannot recommend it enough. Definitely a must-play for an ARPG enthusiast.

185909275.review:
Considering I cannot play it I cannot recommend it.

The game was not designed for larger screens and has no proper coded screen scaling. I can just barely see the menu to adjust this. I have to squint my eyes a foot away from the screen to see the menu. I adjusted it to 4k and it messed up the colors on my screen so badly I had to restart my PC to correct it. It didn't even change the scale of the UI. I adjust the UI scaler in the same menu and this did absolutely nothing as if it is just a slider and no code behind it. I then tried to scale the resolution down to 1080p and it made the screen so small I could no longer see any aspect of the game. It even minimized the window to 25% of my screen and I could not adjust this to full screen again. The scaling also effects where you have to click on screen for the menus so if it's scaled incorrectly in any way the menu becomes a nightmare to navigate because the trigger for your mouse is now offset somewhere else on screen. So I got out my controller because surely the d-pad is mapped correctly to the menu options... Nope. For some reason the menu navigation is also not adjusted to the controller when the screen is at a resolution the game doesn't like. The d-pad just moves the actual mouse cursor to the menu option and as I established before the resolution offsets the clicking trigger event. I cannot even set the screen resolution without significant issues. I'm not entirely certain why this is happening even though I have a suspicion why but I'm not going to take time troubleshooting this. I've never seen a game that has this much trouble with resolution scaling and I've certainly never seen a developer code the triggers for the menu not binded to the buttons themselves. This means the developer placed the onClick() event on an actual hard coded xy value that overlaps the menu button which will offset when the resolution is adjusted rather then bind it to the menu button location on screen. If I'm seeing this type of issues and I haven't even made it in game yet... Nah. It's refund time.

I'm not going to waste my time with this game when I'm having problems just getting out of the damn main menu.

Edit: Look at the forums for this game or just comments under both positive and negative reviews. This is one of the most toxic communities out there. Lmao. Sorry people have legitimate issues with your favorite game. I'll never understand the type of internet trolls who just scour all comments about a game they chose to defend to the death and ignore legitimate issues. DiD i Do GoOd DeFeNdInG yOu GrIm DaWn?

185829143.review:
POE2 终局倦怠以后打开这个在库躺了很久的游戏，即后悔也庆幸，后悔怎么没有早点玩这么好的 ARPG，庆幸在这款游戏多年更新后在现在接近完美的形态开始玩，而且今年还有新的扩展包。
如果说 POE2 将来可能成为最好的 ARPG，恐怖黎明现在就是最好的 ARPG。ARPG 新手可以无脑入，DLC 也全买，有 DLC 才是完整游戏。而对于 ARPG 老兵，恐怖黎明有什么特别的？

它从头到尾都尊重你的时间。

现在的赛季制 ARPG 游戏，重心都放在了终局，而低级的剧情阶段不过是走过场，好像是为了尝到终局的甜而必须吃的苦（POE2 有改进但还不够）。恐怖黎明不是。从游戏的最开始，ARPG 的两样核心，build 和 farm 就在成型了。

Build 是寻找最优解，是谜题和选择，恐怖黎明更快更多地把谜题摆在玩家面前：
- 技能点升一级不是给 1 点而是 3 点
- 镶嵌物从 5 级开始就很重要，而不像其他游戏因为需要打孔是后期内容，这里不需要打孔
- 星座相当于 POE 中的被动技能树，但有意义的大点更靠前，这些会赋予主动技能触发特效，是 Build 的基石，而在很前期就能体验到
- 加技能等级的装备和套装在前期就开始掉落，可以完全按照得到的装备来进行开荒 Build

Farm 赋予了玩家游玩的意义，POE2 和 D4 前期不会有任何 Farm，因为没有意义，前期装备非常弱，很快就要被替换。这也是这些游戏前期与后期游玩体验的割裂的原因之一，而恐怖黎明通过很多巧妙而统一的设计，让前期的 Farm 更有意义：
- 精妙的数值设计，一件 50 级的装备和终局的装备，在面板上看是两倍的数值而不是十倍或百倍，开荒期的装备保质期更长
- 一些怪物有特定掉落，这些掉落非常适合于某些 Build，甚至在终局是最好的装备
- 装备槽位多，总共 14 个，比起 D4 这些多出了护肩和勋章等部位，这意味着掉落提升角色的可能性更大
- 慷慨的掉率，独特的史诗装备和传奇装备相当于其他游戏的暗金和套装，掉得更早更多，DLC 更是提供了新的掉落途径
- 势力声望系统，Farm 至少会推进声望，而声望奖励非常优越，一方面可以直接买很好的开荒装备，另一方面终局总是需要买声望给的增辐，所以前期的 Farm 也为终局做了准备

恐怖黎明还有太多优秀之处，如手工设计的地图，塞满了奖励驱动，或是 Build 的丰富性，或是数值上的精妙，也不需要一一提及，能做好前期的 Build 和 Farm 就值得每一个 ARPG 老兵的时间。
这也不是说恐怖黎明在终局的 Build 和 Farm 就不出彩，只是我刚通第一个难度全 DLC，还没打到终局，没什么可说的。
总之推荐给每一个人，这游戏里每一秒都是值得的，在 ARPG 里很少见。

185785173.review:
Anfangs war ich skeptisch - der nächste Diablo-Klon. Ich habe viel Diablo 1,2 & 4 gezockt, in Path Of Exile habe ich was-weiß-ich-wieviele Stunden versenkt - kurz: ich liebe ARPGs. Doch lange Zeit habe ich Grim Dawn links liegen gelassen. Was ich heute bereue! 

Habe jetzt in 26h die Kampagne das erste Mal durchgespielt. Hat echt viel Spaß gemacht, das Design der Welt ist gut gelungen, auch wenn es keine Open World ist. 
Anfangs fand ich die vielen Affixe der Items etwas verwirrend, doch wenn man etwas Erfahrung mit dem Genre hat findet man sich schnell zurecht. Auf den ersten Blick gibt es nicht viele Skills, doch dieser Eindruck täuscht gewaltig. Denn Grim Dawn geht bei der Charakter-Entwicklung eher in Richtung Path Of Exile. Aber keine Angst, man wird hier nicht mit einem mehrere Screens füllendem Talent-Baum erschlagen! 
Stattdessen wählt man bei Erreichen von Level 2 seine erste Klasse. Erreicht man Level 10, wählt man eine zweite Klasse, die Kombination dieser zwei Klassen ergibt dann die eigentliche Klasse. Ich habe beispielsweise Arcanist und Occultist genommen, diese beiden Klassen wurden dann zum Warlock. 
Mit den beiden DLCs gibt es neun Klassen, die man beliebig miteinander kombinieren kann. Unterm Strich ergibt das eine hübsche Vielfalt an spielbaren Klassen. Geskillt werden dann jeweils die Skill Trees der jeweiligen Klasse. 
Dazu gibt es noch einen dritten Skill Tree um euren Build je nach Geschmack zu skillen, den Devotion Tree. Verteilt in der gesamten Welt findet man Devotion Schreine, die euch je einen Punkt geben. Der Devotion Tree gibt verschiedene Boni auf eure Attribute, dazu kann man einzelne Skills mit einem zusätzlichen Effekt ausstatten. 
Zugegeben, das klingt alles nach viel, ist in der Praxis aber ziemlich intuitiv. Und hat man einen Fehler gemacht und merkt, daß die aktuelle Skillung nicht wie gewünscht funktioniert, kann man in der Stadt jederzeit gegen einen (sehr) kleinen Preis seine Punkte umverteilen. 

Grim Dawn generiert eine schön düstere Atmosphäre und spielt sich flüssig. Wer ARPGs mag kann hier guten Gewissens zugreifen.

Raramente eu posto alguma análise no Steam, mas este merece:
O jogo foi lançado em 2016, continua recebendo atualizações e consegue ser melhor que vários 'AAA' do mesmo gênero. O mais interessante do Grim Dawn é que não existem builds tier S, A, B, etc; o jogo te dá o livre arbítrio de criar a sua. Entretanto, se você é daqueles que prefere tudo "mastigado", no site https://www.grimtools.com/ você irá encontrar as mais diversas builds, criadas pela própria comunidade gamer do jogo. Se você nunca jogou um ARPG, e está querendo se aventurar, GD é uma ótima pedida. E para os que já são familiarizados com o gênero, vale a pena dar uma chance.

185670273.review:
[h1]Grim Dawn[/h1] es un juegazo de rol y acción que te va a enganchar de principio a fin. Imagináte un mundo lleno de bichos y monstruos donde tenés que luchar para sobrevivir, mejorar tu personaje y hacerte más fuerte.

Lo más copado del juego es la libertad que te da para personalizar tu personaje. Podés elegir entre diferentes clases y combinarlas a tu gusto, creando un héroe único que se adapta a tu estilo de juego. Además, el árbol de habilidades y las constelaciones te permiten probar un montón de estrategias diferentes, lo que lo hace muy entretenido.

La jugabilidad de Grim Dawn es realmente uno de sus puntos fuertes.

[h1]Clases y Personalización[/h1]
Podés elegir entre varias clases como Soldado, Ocultista, Demoledor, entre otros, y combinarlas para crear un personaje que se ajuste a tu estilo de juego. Esta libertad te permite experimentar con diferentes habilidades y tácticas.

[h1]Sistema de Habilidades[/h1]
El árbol de habilidades es extenso y profundo, ofreciéndote un montón de opciones para personalizar tu personaje. Además, las constelaciones agregan una capa extra de estrategia, permitiéndote mejorar habilidades específicas y adaptarlas a tus necesidades.

[h1]Combate y Exploración[/h1]
El combate es fluido y satisfactorio, con una variedad de armas y hechizos que hacen que cada enfrentamiento sea emocionante. Además, el juego te invita a explorar un mundo vasto y lleno de secretos, misiones secundarias y desafíos.

[h1]Loot y Crafting[/h1]
El sistema de loot es muy gratificante. Vas a estar constantemente encontrando equipo nuevo y mejorando a tu personaje. El crafting también es una parte importante del juego, permitiéndote crear y mejorar tu equipo con los materiales que encontrás en tus aventuras.

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
Si te gusta jugar con amigos, Grim Dawn ofrece un modo multijugador donde podés unirte a otros jugadores para enfrentar desafíos juntos. Esto añade un montón de diversión y posibilidades de estrategia en grupo.

En resumen, Grim Dawn es una joya en el género de los ARPG, que ofrece una experiencia envolvente y satisfactoria para los amantes de este tipo de juegos. Si buscas un juego que te mantenga enganchado durante horas, este es definitivamente una excelente opción.

185667494.review:
Falo com convicção: este é o melhor ARPG isométrico da atualidade - que não está na categoria de "jogo como serviço" — caso contrário, Path of Exile 1 e 2 seriam ótimos concorrentes . Nem mesmo a Blizzard conseguiu entregar um ARPG à altura desde os clássicos Diablo 1 e 2. Dentre os vários pontos de destaque de Grim Dawn, eu consigo citar os seguintes:
- O sistema de combinação de classes é bem diferente, você tem ali (considerando as DLC's) 9 classes base, e podendo realizar a combinação com mais uma classe, você tem a possibilidade de criar até 44 classes;
- Habilidades e poderes trazem peso e fluidez ao combate, fazendo com que cada encontro seja satisfatório.
- A atmosfera sombria, aliada a uma narrativa rica e bem construída, me manteve engajado e curioso sobre o desfecho da história.
- Conteúdo de Endgame: Repleto de desafios, dungeons, facções e atividades para explorar, garantindo horas de diversão mesmo após finalizar a campanha principal.
- Suporte a Mods: A possibilidade de mods amplia ainda mais a rejogabilidade, permitindo aos fãs personalizar e expandir o jogo ao infinito.
- A trilha sonora ambiente é excelente e contribui muito para a atmosfera sombria do jogo, lembrando o estilo marcante de Diablo 2. 
- Já a temática se destaca por fugir do convencional entre os ARPGs, que geralmente exploram criaturas mitológicas, demônios e fantasia medieval. Grim Dawn aposta em uma ambientação inspirada na era vitoriana, com inimigos interdimensionais devastando a humanidade — é uma premissa inusitada, mas que traz uma originalidade bem-vinda. 

Não posso deixar de elogiar o cuidado da Crate Entertainment com este jogo: sem monetização abusiva, passes ou qualquer outra prática predatória, e ainda assim eles continuam atualizando o título mesmo após 8 anos de seu lançamento.

Recomendo.

185667216.review:
Looks good, runs well on low-specs (60fps 720p on my intel UHD graphics), and has potential for loot'n build enjoyers
However, keeping in mind this is my first diablo-like, I don't like the gameplay loop, as combat is basically "Spamming skills at dumb mobs while running in circle".

I assume the main points of these games are intricate build possibilities and looting frenzy, but fighting in Grim Dawn still feels irrelevant to me. I'm wondering if I wouldn't prefer that the game was nothing but a button that gives xp and loot every time I press it.
Gear and game knowledge aside, after 7 hours, I feel like my fighting skills are the same as during my first minutes. The only satisfaction I got from fighting was through earning XP and loot, which has nothing to do with the enjoyment of slaying mobs.


Grim Dawn also reminds me of the cheap mobile games that flood the market, relying on extremely basic and repetitive game loops and shots of dopamine through "fake" rewards that get deprecated the next hour after you acquire them. I understand the appeal, but it's not my cup of tea.

185645521.review:
I bought this game this holiday sale and I have two problems with it. First, I didn't know about it sooner and second it's going to be harder to get into other arpgs after playing this one because it's so good. A few things stand out to me in this game compared to other arpgs.

The early game doesn't feel like a slog. From the beginning of the game you pick up a skill and keep improving and refining your build until you become super powerful. The skills from early on feel good to use and you don't run out of mana/energy after two usages just because it's early game.

Exploration is encouraged especially in your first playthrough. You can discover shrines (which give devotion points and make your character stronger), you can open chests, find elites, story notes (which you can use to gain exp!) and even kill quest npcs or loot quest objects. The cool thing about this game is that if you kill an npc or loot a quest object before picking up the quest you can still hand in the quest the same the dialogue just changes. You never feel like you made the wrong decision or miss out on exp/loot regardless of the decisions you make. You're free to approach the game however you like.

Story is very good for an arpg. The story is well developed and interesting which is surprising for this game genre as that's not usually the case.

Easy to get into but still has a lot of depth. It feels easy and intuitive to figure out what items you need for your build but as you play you'll keep on finding more and more things to make your character stronger (skills, attributes, devotion points, relics and so much more!)

10/10 game and would highly recommend. Go for the definitive edition you won't regret it!

185624377.review:
[h1]Great game, Incompotent devs[/h1]

[h3]Don't recommend, even for the 2.50 it cost[/h3]

Grim dawn is an entry into the ARPG diablo like genre with a fistful of great ideas. Like Multi classing. that's pretty 'dope' in and of itself, but the act of doing so is a scam.

Let me break it down, so you the reader can understand how amazing yet absolutely garbage this game is, because the devs thought it would be funny to not only have esoteric knowledge to understand the stats in this game, they also decided to troll you the player by having one of the stupidest systems ever conceived.

So every class has a discipline bar that requires points independent of your skills. the discipline bar is where a good 50% of your actual stats come from. this would not be a problem but it becomes a problem later in the game when you inevitably find out on a blind play through that multi classing will actually hurt you in the long run. Unless you have your build planned out you are inevitably going to hit a wall in terms of stat and gear progression. The BS starts around level 20 or 25 when you find out this games gear has item level garbage and expects you to gear climb to equip level appropriate items or use devotions that are completely unrelated to your build to "fix" the problems. Which I don't think I should have to tell you this, but if I have to have prior esoteric knowledge on your games inner working on normal mode, then your game is terrible. Because by the time I got to a spoiler location at level 40 and started looking at guides to figure out if I was doing something wrong and why I could not equip level appropriate gear. I realized I was doing everything wrong. but I am not taking the L for this games horrifying lack of conveyance because the devs want to be Diablo 3.1 the path of torchlight wild tangent edition. So low and behold I "finished" the game wearing gear that I was using at level 18 on normal+veteran.

[h2]But wait! There is even more reason not to buy this game[/h2]

when I was actually enjoying the game, up until Cronley, I suggested the game to someone else. Which led me to find out the game is on console, and that console version has a complete edition. It was 8USD. now lets do some basic math and check out the on sale prices of all the DLC plus base game on sale on steam. Well that is about 25 bucks, off sale each of those DLCs is about 17 bucks aside from the cosmetics, and the roguelike mode so realistically off sale it comes to about 70 USD if you want everything and on top of all of that the only way to fully respec your character is to own the expansions, yes I am not kidding you can respec your skills and nothing else in the base game so you can literally pay to unscrew your character if it is sincerely that bad. So knowing that I'm just going to say crate entertainment is a dev you probably should actively avoid if you care about consumer practices across platforms. which no one on steam really does but thats a different conversation.

[h3]Finally[/h3]

Story is fine, base UI is absolutely garbage, the controller support actually makes zero sense and led to an even worse play experience than the one I thought I was having on keyboard. If you're curious about it, buy it on deep sale, but if you have no intention of getting the dlc don't bother because apparently the dlc "fixes" most the problem but if you still decided to buy it on sale do a full uninstall at [spoiler]old arkovia[/spoiler] because that's where the fun stops. The devs are openly incompetent on the forums too, which I find pretty funny. I love how this developer made a post on the steam forums saying they didn't want to spend engineering time making something experimental and mediocre, when all grim dawn is, is an experimental and mediocre experience piggy backing on hundreds of ideas from games before it.

The game isn't terrible but it certainly isn't good either. I will continue playing it with friends, and that is quite frankly all I have to say about this game. Anything that I've described that is wrong, I will be blaming on bad conveyance from the game and its devs, because after 33 hours I am highly disappointed and from here on will be ignoring crate entertainment.

185540022.review:
Grim Dawn – A Solid and Engaging ARPG

Grim Dawn is a top-tier action RPG set in a dark, post-apocalyptic world that offers a satisfying and immersive experience. The game delivers deep character customization, engaging loot systems, and fast-paced combat that keeps you hooked. The class and skill system is highly flexible, allowing for diverse builds and playstyles, which is one of the game's standout features.

The world design is expertly crafted, with atmospheric, grim environments that perfectly capture the dark tone of the story. While the narrative isn't groundbreaking, it fits well within the game's immersive world. The combat is fluid, rewarding players with a mix of strategic planning and action-heavy battles.

Overall, *Grim Dawn* offers a rich, satisfying ARPG experience. If you enjoy dark, immersive settings and games like *Diablo* or *Path of Exile*, this is a solid choice that will keep you engaged for hours.

185516617.review:
This is an awesome ARPG. It is a very usual isometric view ARPG but one good thing about this is that, as compared to D4, this game has a much wider zoomed out view and I like it. 

I've approximately 120ish hours invested as of writing this review, the itemization in this game is also pretty easy to understand and the enhancing of gears' concept is also very easy to grasp. 

The campaign itself is really really enormously huge and the game largely focused on the campaign mode itself. 

The gear system comprises of mainly the normal white, rare green, epic blue and lastly purple legendary/unique. The uniques are similar to that of D2 game, you can find same pieces of unique but they can have different roll in their stats just like a 120def shako vs a 141 perfect shako defense. All in all, the game is really well developed. Gameplay is smooth, graphic could be slightly outdated but it still look really really well. 

The only downside or complain that I have for this game is that, in some zones, the terrain could be horrendously hard to navigate around. They are usually the stairs, narrow pathways, etc...

The game aged really well nontheless. 2 thumbs up to the developers and if you are wondering if you should get this to try it, I'd definitely 100% recommend if you are an ARPG enthusiast.

185474161.review:
[h1]A Hack n Slashing Gameplay[/h1]
This game is a bit like Diablo (the older ones).
You can build your own Character, choose your own classes and even build them by yourself. You can get points by leveling up and with these points, you can learn or upgrade your skills. Just like the old times in Diablo or even Baldurs Gate. Also you can make a devoution build, that gives you extra stats and extra abilities for your skills.

[h1] Many Classes but...[/h1]
Yeah there are a lot of classes like Warrior, Assassin, Range and several types of Magican (Arkane, Oculist etc.).
I like this kinda stuff and you can even choose a second class after a time but the problem I have is ... many classes doesn't have a good counterpart like Assassin. I mean he is fighting with dual blades and you can build up a second build for your char but it's not very much possible because you don't get that much of points and shriens for your devotion stuff.
And about getting good stuff... we will come to that later.

[h1]Building your character is something else![/h1]
It's weird to complaing about too much gameplay stuff!
It isn't even about the story or the Map, this is totaly fine and well made, but let me tell you something about: "It is hard to build a second build!" and their comes my "it's to fricking much!".
It's cool that you can completely build free like whatever you want, but you losing yourself in it too fast. 
Their are like 20 different builds in Devoution and the skilltree for your classes are way to expensive. 
At the beginning your skills are not strong enought and if they are, they are getting outclassed.
To find out, what fits great to your build, you are spending about 2 hours maybe and for me, it's not worth it.

[h1]Getting a shiney Pokemon is more likely than getting good stuff[/h1]
I don't know if I have just the worst luck in this game, but the drop rate is something else!
It's damn hard to get a good, usable weapon or armor peace in this game and it is damn frustrating mostly because the enemy are getting harder and farming the enemies because of getting stuff and not even because of leveling is a bit weird and if you getting stuff for your level, it's often worse than the stuff you already have.
And some of these armor pieces are a wall of text that is just painfull to read 
(Yeah I know I have some kind of allergic reaction to reading or whatever xD).

[h1]You can suffer in Coop[/h1]
Yeah ok, suffering is not the right word and makes pretty much fun playing this with a friend.
Their can be some lags (that even can kill you in game) and I have sometimes a random blackscreen and game crashes but still it is fun to play. 
Also if you die in a special dungeon in coop, you can't join this dungeon anymore and your friend is on his own in this dungeon.

[h1]My Opinion about this[/h1]
Hard to tell and there is DLC stuff as well which I will (probably) never play.
All at all it is a very fun game to play in your free time but still I need to say that you will need to spend much time building your char to even have a chance against your enemy. There's also a story, but I pretty much lost track of it and didn't pay much attention to it, sadly.
So would I recommend it?
Yes for people having definitly fun playing games like that and were fans from Diablo 1 to 3 and the old Baldur Gates. And if not ... well it's worth a try but buy it when it is on sale and play it with a good friend.

185471014.review:
+ 

• 3D mit Retrografik die an die früheren Diabolo Teile erinnert
• düstere Atmosphäre, immersive Welt im postapokalyptischen Setting
• umfangreiches Klassensystem mit Dual-Klassen-Option
• hohe Flexibilität beim Skill- und Attribut-Management
• Entscheidungsfreiheit in Quests, die Einfluss auf die Welt hat
• Zufallsgenerierter Loot


- 

• Inventarverwaltung manchmal unübersichtlich
•  solide, aber technisch nicht auf dem neuesten Stand
•  erinnert mich zu stark an MMORPGs, was nicht so mein Fall ist

[h1] Fazit [/h1]
Ist ein Spiel im durchschnittlichen Bereich, wenn man Lust auf Retro Zombie Action Spiel hat, kann man das mal spielen. Habs im Sale geholt für 4 € dafür war es okay. 
Ist für mich eine 4,5/10 Sterne-Spiel.

__________________________________________

+

• 3D with retro graphics reminiscent of the early Diablo titles
• dark atmosphere, immersive world in a post-apocalyptic setting
• comprehensive class system with dual-class option
• high flexibility in skill and attribute management
• decision-making in quests that impacts the world
• randomly generated loot

-
• Inventory management can be somewhat confusing
• solid but not technically up-to-date
• feels too much like MMORPGs, which isn't really my thing

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
This is an average game. If you're in the mood for a retro zombie action game, it might be worth a shot. I picked it up on sale for €4, and for that price, it was okay.
For me, it's a 4.5/10 stars game.

185429975.review:
Вот я и осилил Grim Dawn. Взяв игру за 2 доллара по скидке без DLC не ожидал от нее ничего особенного, но вот спустя 4 дня и за 18 внутриигровых часов я ее все-таки прошел.
Что могу сказать сразу? Свои 2 доллара игра точно стоила. Порекомендовал бы ее взять даже за 5$. За больше бы не брал т.к. не фанат данного жанра, а за эти деньги на распродаже можно взять 2-3 игры куда получше.

И так, графика... ну, в Grim Dawn она есть. Врать не буду, при первом запуске игры графика меня оттолкнула. Со временем привыкаешь и глаза уже не так часто режет, а местами она выглядит даже красиво.
Геймплейно игра довольно приятна. Главное перетерпеть первые 5-10 уровней персонажа, пока не дойдешь до нужного тебе скилла.
Прокачка в игре меня порадовала. Помимо выбора двух классов, со временем станут доступны еще и созвездия. Последние довольно просты для понимания, и дают огромнейший буст урона для персонажа. Нужно только не забывать пользоваться поиском вверху вкладки.
Система лута в игре мне тоже зашла. Начиная с зеленого шмота и выше, глаза периодически разбегаются от количества характеристик. Но есть одна проблема, игра иногда тебе нагло врет во вкладке ДПС, так что при смене вещей частенько нужно думать своей головой, а не слепо верить цифрам во внутриигровой менюшке. В игре присутствует удобный лутфильтр.
Сюжет и квесты, тоже ничего такие, как и общая атмосфера игры.

Да почти ко всему в игре я отнесся или хорошо, или нейтрально, так что проще вспомнить о том, что мне не понравилось.
Начну с боссов. Они крайне неинтересные губки для битья. Если пачка мобов падает с одного скилла, то когда натыкаешься на босса, по которому нужно дать ударов 20-30, а то и больше, то их проблемы на подобном контрасте слишком заметны. Были бы у них интересные скиллы и механики...
Следующей проблемой будет AI. Мобы слишком часто фигачат в стену между тобой и ними. Это выглядит крайне плохо. Погружение в игру от вида подобного мгновенно пропадает.
Собственный пассинг меня тоже раздражал. Иногда можно куда-то нажать, и персонаж чуть ли не пол карты сам пробежит до нужного места, а иногда ты кликаешь чтобы подобрать предмет, а это чучело прет куда-то совсем мимо. Слишком часто данная проблема меня отвлекала.

Игра была пройдена за 18 часов, за которые я открыл 95%+ всех локаций и прошел почти все квесты. Закончил ее 45-46 уровнем, а потом добил еще 1 чтобы увидеть, как мой билд будет работать на более высоком уровне. Там как раз этого одного левела не хватало для открытия последней нужной мне способности. Перепроходить игру на следующем уровне сложности или за другой класс желания как-то не возникло. Почему? - потому что игра сингловая и ощущается слишком маленькой для того, чтобы провести в ней еще больше времени. Но если когда-нибудь на дополнение с классом Некромант будет большая скидка, и я смогу его урвать за те же 2 доллара, то я вижу себя проходящим Grim Dawn еще раз.
В общем и целом, взять игру по скидке я точно рекомендую.

185377569.review: This is a fantastic ARPG. The mood is just right for those looking for a darker, D2 sort of vibe. The music, setting, story and visuals pull you into a dark, gothic fantasy world. 185376470.review:
As a massive fan of Diablo 3, I was deeply disappointed with how Diablo 4 turned out as modern AAA slop. Grim Dawn, albeit an older game, holds up extremely well. The duel class system is very engaging, I am enjoying my play-through as a Warder, Soldier/Shaman.

The loot feels plentiful and the legendaries when they drop are exciting to see! 
Something I am not a fan of is getting loot that pertains to other classes, it's disappointing to get something new that doesn't remotely relate to my classes at all. The loot filter has largely solved this problem, but I did not make real use of it until maybe level 40 or so. 

It's not crucial to have the DLCs, I played through the entire base game before buying them and the only difference I noticed it would have made, is missing loot from the Trial Totems that spawn around the map and some UI changes. 

Overall I would definitely recommend Grim Dawn to players looking to get into ARPGs or players who are looking for a new one to start.

185263420.review:
Grim Dawn is a decent game for one playthrough, but the lack of endgame activities and basically nothing to grind for is killing motivation to play more characters, which is pretty bad, because games from this genre should be replayable to the point you can play them for the rest of your life.

There are some endgame acitivies, but I really doubt someone will enjoy them for a long time. 

"Roguelike Dungeons", which are not roguelike by the way, have always the same map layout, always same monsters, they take really long time to complete and are not rewarding compared to Shattered Realms.

Shattered Realms (something like Diablo 3 rifts) have more map layouts, so it makes it less repetitive, but there is nothing going on on these maps. Sometimes you'll find a shrine, which require currency to use, and that's it. So you go in, clear mobs, and go to another map. Also there are no drops in SR, you'll get items only at the end in reward room.

I hated arena in Last Epoch and here in GD Crucible Arena is no different, I just think this is boring, but maybe some like this type of content.

Some poeple say there are Nemesis Bosses and Totems to do in endgame, but there is really no point of doing nemesis unsless you need their specific MI (unique rare items, that can have also random affixes), Totems on the other hand are great for getting item recipes, but they are also pretty repetitive.

You might think: wait, this endgame is very similiar to what Diablo 2 had, and it was pretty decent game. Well, yes, Diablo 2 had an open endgame, where there was no specified place to farm. The difference between endgames in D2 and GD is that in Diablo 2 you actally had something to grind for. It could be super rare uniques, not always useful in builds, but really satisfying to find or you could find really rare runes, used to create powerful Runewords.
So my problem with Grim Dawn is that, there is nothing to grind for really, you'll never be excited about a random, unexpected drop when farming, especially after they changed one thing in 1.2 version, that makes bosses always drop their MI. How can I be excited about drop that I know I will find and how can I be excited about running the same map layout for 100th time, looking for a perfect set of affixes?

The maps in Grim Dawn are not procedurally generated, so you'll be running the same maps all the time you want to farm specific item, and all the time you create new character. One of the pillars of Hack and Slash games are randomly generated maps, and Grim Dawn is definitely not standing on that pillar, so it's not a H&S, it's an RPG game with H&S elements.

I really dislike item progression in this game. First you are introduced to normal and magic items, which become irrelevant after 10 minutes of gameplay, so you can uncheck them in filter. I really think that's a waste comparing to D2 and PoE, where even white and magic items matters in crafting.
Next you'll be equiping rare items, and then switch to Legendaries with maybe 1 or 2 Monster Infrequents, depends on the build. You skip Blue (Epic) items, they are useless anyway.
My problem with Legendaries: they are boring, very boring, because they are just normal items with bumped up stats, and sometimes set bonuses. Also get used to set bonuses, game is literally forcing you to play specific set and specific skills, like in Diablo 3, leaving very little freedom for theorycrafting builds. From Uniques and Legendary items I expect them to be interesting, have UNIQUE stats that will allow crazy builds, and i expect some of them to be really rare to find, in GD i didn't found any of those aspects of items.

Nobody's gonna negate that PoE did it's best job in creating interesting items. There are many uniques, and even modifiers on rare items, that will enable new builds. Such as Mana stacker, giving you bonuses depending on your mana pool. Attribute stackers, where you try to max out attributes on your gear to reach new highs. Even simple +2 to projectile count is very satisfying upgrade to your character.
So that's why I'm dissapointed in GD itemisation, there is nothing that compare to modifiers listed above.

The world scales up to your level. Basically nothing more to add to it, it's the bane upon all h&s games, where you should feel progress of your character, but in this game when you level up, and go back few zones, all monsters will be scaled up to your level, meaning they'll have higher defences, so I ask, where is satisfaction from leveling and upgrading, if a basic zombie mob can stand the same amount of hits no matter what your level is.

Faction system. Again a mechanic that shouldn't be in h&s. The whole faction system in Grim Dawn exists just to hide from you augments that increase your resistances. Again I ask, where is satisfaction from getting that? Why those augments are not rare drops that you'll get only from Ultimate difficulty, so you can slowly but surely farm these and be more excited about upgrading your character towards endgame. There is just no fun in buying stuff from npc that will solve your resistance problem. Hack and Slash games should offer interesting problems that player have to solve, such as their resistanced, attributes. Unfortunetaly in GD you'll always have maxed out resists and there will be no time ever where you're missing some attributes to equip new gear.

Also, I've seen the devs want to make another tier of Rare items, because MI are too powerful, what's next? Super-omega Empowered Legendaries? If you have to make another tier of your item rarity, there is definitely something wrong with your itemisation system.

Bossfights are not memorable, after that many hour played I have no idea what are bosses names, I don't even know if they have unique voicelines. I think this is really important for boss to have their unique lines, like you hear it in PoE or D2, once heard you'll remember it for life.

There is a huge problem with monster design in general in all modern h&s games. Diablo 2 did it the best and implemented true monster variety, not only in visuals, but in AI behavior. Unfortunetaly, all monster designs in modern h&s depends on enemies rushing you down.

I've seen people are obsessed about secrets in the game, if they meant secret bosses and areas with quests I can get that, it's good for game to have secrets like that, but if they also meant secret walls, where you can find usually one or two chests and a dead body, then I think you'll all insane, as there is literally no value in that type of secret room, one may be happy to find it in their first playthrough, but for a long period of time they are useless, as there will be no gear better than yours in that secret rooms.

The story is ok, nothing spectacular, many npcs doesn't have their voices, but I think that's a budget thing so whatever. There are many lore notes in the world, I honestly prefer other types of lore telling than standing for 2 minutes and reading in a Action game.

Graphics I didn't mind the most of my time spent in game, however some skills are not satisfying to use.

Music in many locations is really good, however boss soundtracks just feels very off.

Overall if you're looking for and action game for one playthrough, you may grab this one, but I'll not recommend it for anyone who want to invest crazy amount of time in one title, as there is very little interesting gameplay loop.

Unusual for me but I'll leave comments open, so Mr. The_Mess can cry about someone disagreeing with his opinion, seriously bro, go out touch some grass and then play some other games.

185253522.review:
[h1]O VERDADEIRO SUCESSOR DE DIABLO[/h1]

Existem certas combinações que dão muito certo. Diablo foi um destes raros casos onde a combinação certas de diversos elementos culminou em algo atemporal. A estória macabra, a ambientação intimidadora, os acordes misteriosos da trilha sonora, a jogabilidade relativamente simples e as várias possibilidades de montar o seu personagem. Tudo isso foi combinado de uma maneira muito particular que marcou para sempre a vida de muitas pessoas.
Diablo 2 soube dar continuidade a isso de forma inteligente, expandindo o conceito do primeiro jogo em todos os aspectos, mas preservando tudo aquilo que o tornava especial. Diablo 3 já não se saiu tão bem. E Diablo Immortal foi uma piada de mau gosto. 

Nos dez anos que separam o lançamento de Diablo 3 e Diablo 4 é onde surge Grim Dawn. Muito mais do que uma homenagem bem feita, Grim Dawn é considerado por muitos o verdadeiro sucessor de Diablo 2.
Lançado em 2016 pela Crate Entertainment, Grim Dawn traz tudo aquilo que os primeiros dois Diablo tinham. O jogo foi feito na engine de outro grande ARPG dos anos 2000, Titan Quest, e segue muitas das mecânicas que fizeram deste um dos melhores jogos do gênero. Aliás, as similaridades entre os dois jogos não são à toa já que os fundadores da Crate são alguns dos principais criadores de Titan Quest. Sendo assim, não seria errado dizer que Grim Dawn está para Titan Quest o mesmo que Diablo 2 está para Diablo: maior, melhor, mas mantendo tudo aquilo que fez o primeiro game ser único.

Titan Quest inovou ao trazer um sistema de classe dupla. No começo do jogo escolhemos uma classe, ou maestria. Em determinado momento mais adiante nos é oferecida a opção de escolher uma segunda maestria. A nossa classe final será o resultado dessa combinação.
Grim Dawn segue a mesma fórmula. As diferentes combinações entre as 10 classes disponíveis no jogo permite até 90 classes diferentes e cada uma dessas classes pode ser jogada de formas diferentes, dependendo dos itens e das armas que você decidir usar.
Outro ponto muito positivo herdado de Titan Quest são as mecânicas de combate e dano. É aquilo que eu defino como "simples, mas complexo; complexo, mas simples". O jogo é bastante direto sobre os diferentes tipos de dano e debuffs, bem como as camadas de defesa. Pra quem quer apenas curtir a estória ou jogar com os amigos o sistema é bem simples, mas sem ser entediante. Mas à medida em que se progride para os modos mais difíceis é preciso quebrar um pouco a cabeça para otimizar sua build e encontrar os melhores itens.

Mas nem tudo é uma cópia de Titan Quest. Grim Dawn também trouxe mecânicas próprias, além de corrigir problemas de seu antecessor.
O sistema de constelações talvez seja maior adição. À medida que vamos jogando encontramos alguns totens espalhados pelo mundo. Ao restaurar este totem ganhamos um ponto para ser gasto na tela de constelações. A sensação de ver essa tela pela primeira vez é a mesma de ver a árvore de passivas do Path of Exile. Você abre e tem um milhão de coisas para escolher. Se você não tem TDAH agora vai ter. Mas existe uma lógica que direciona as escolhas e descobrir essa lógica é parte do desafio do jogo.
Há também um sistema de facção onde você pode cumprir tarefas para ganhar respeito de um grupo e dessa forma desbloquear itens e missões exclusivas. Infelizmente não existe realmente um sistema onde você se aliar a uma facção fecha o caminho para outra. Há apenas um momento onde isso acontece, mas as duas facções são meio que a mesma coisa. Mas ainda assim é uma adição muito bem-vinda.
Por fim, uma das correções mais importantes feitas em relação ao Titan Quest é o dano crítico. Em TQ apenas ataques corpo a corpo podem dar crítico. Magias e ataques à distância não. Grim Dawn corrige isso e agora todo e qualquer dano tem chance de dar crítico - como aliás deve ser em todo ARPG.

Sobre a parte estética, o jogo é bem bonito. Os gráficos, sobre tudo os personagens, lembram um pouco Diablo 3 e Warcraft 3, mas com um tom mais cinzento e sombrio. O mundo é extremamente detalhado e repleto de segredos, com passagens escondidas que facilmente podem passar batidas na primeira vez. Os sons são muitos bons e a trilha sonora se encaixa perfeitamente pra criar um clima de desolação e ruína.
A otimização é bastante boa. Roda liso, mas também tem várias opções para PCs mais lentos. Suporte nativo para Ultrawide, tamanho do HUD customizável. O filtro de loot é bastante útil, embora seja muito menos customizável do que o de Last Epoch, por exemplo. Há uma infinidade de itens divididos em várias categorias. Os afixos dos itens também são muitos. Os monstros aparecem em grandes números. Monstros únicos e chefes são bem legais até, mas eles seguem o padrão clássico dos primeiros Diablo. Ou seja, nada de indicação visual para habilidades em área e outras coisas que temos em jogos mais novos.
O multiplayer, infelizmente, segue o mesmo padrão de Titan Quest. É ruim. Jogar sozinho ou com amigos é muito bom, mas jogar com randômicos na Internet não é uma experiência muito boa.

Sobre as DLCs, existem três essenciais, uma de arena e três cosméticas.
Ashes of Malmouth é a que adiciona mais conteúdo. Uma nova campanha e duas classes, Necromante e Inquisidor. Forgotten Gods traz outra campanha e a classe do Oathkeeper (Paladino). E por fim, Fangs of Asterkarn, que no momento em que escrevo ainda não está disponível, mas trará uma nova campanha e uma nova classe, Berserker.
Crucible Mode é uma DLC de arena e é exatamente o que o nome diz. São 6 arenas diferentes onde você enfrenta desafios cada vez maiores e acumula recompensas melhores. Não é um estilo de jogo que eu gosto muito. Não sei dizer se existem itens ou sets exclusivos para esta DLC.
Steam Loyalist Pack 1, 2 e 3 são DLCs puramente cosméticas que você compra apenas como forma de  ajudar a financiar o estúdio.
[b]Recomendo comprar o Grim Dawn Definitive Edition quando estiver em promoção.[/b]

Jogo recomendadíssimo para quem gosta de ARPG clássico com mecânicas fáceis de entender mas difíceis de dominar e onde você não precisa tirar um mestrado para entender a fundo o jogo e nem precisa ficar recorrendo a builds complicadas e sites externos para aproveitar o endgame. É sentar e jogar, e deixar que o próprio jogo te ensine a jogar. Aliás, como todo jogo de ARPG deveria ser.

185188015.review:
Grim Dawn от компании Crate Entertainment - это настоящий шедевр в жанре action RPG, который захватывает с первых минут и не отпускает до самого конца. 

Одним из главных преимуществ игры является её увлекательный и глубокий геймплей. Разнообразие классов персонажей, множество умений и возможность комбинировать их создают бесконечные стратегии и тактики боя. Кроме того, игра предлагает огромный открытый мир, который исследуется с удовольствием благодаря интересным квестам и разнообразным врагам.

Проработанный сюжет и атмосфера мрачного фэнтезийного мира добавляют игре глубину и заставляют задуматься не только над битвой, но и над смыслом происходящего. Графика и звуковое сопровождение также на высшем уровне, погружая вас в атмосферу мрачного и опасного мира Grim Dawn.

Постоянное обновление и поддержка со стороны разработчиков делают игру Grim Dawn качественным продуктом. 

Рекомендую игру тем, кто хочет окунуться в захватывающее приключение с глубоким сюжетом и увлекательным геймплеем.

185154230.review:
Now I wanna say real quick I'm not finished with Grim dawn yet not by a long shot, But I just wanna say this game Is Incredible and is deserving of all the love and hype around it. A lot of people look at the date and the gameplay trailer and assume its "outdated" or "overhyped." (when they haven't even played it yet but honestly that's the average modern gamer in a nutshell tbh so lets move on.) The gameplay is the near perfect medium between diablo and POE, Its just simple enough where you would not need to look up a guide to help you but is complicated enough to make the progression engaging. It may look intimidating but all you need to know is if a stat goes up that's usually good and if your dps drops a tiny bit but raises your defenses increases majorly that's also good. The gems system is as simple as putting a extra boost on your gear. (if there able to added to that specific piece though of course.) The level up and devotion system is great and offers so many ways to customize your character and once you get to level 10 you can choose a second class to pair with your existing class and help synergize with your character and even each class you pair has a unique name once you choose your second class. (which is cool and I love that.) The devotion system is a way to get extra stat buffs and even unique abilities to then pair with your main skills, you will need to find devotion shrines around the world and some are hidden but there worth it to spend a bit of time getting them to massively boost your character. The story. (Who cares about a story in a ARPG.) The exploration is great and its encouraged to go to optional locations because while its more difficult it greatly rewards you with exp, high level loot and even devotion shrines. The base game is worth it even at full price but the game and its DLCs go on sale pretty often plus its going to have a new expansion later this year. overall this game is amazing a needs WAY more love and Im hyped to play even more of this game. Love yourself and thanks for reading my review :)
TLDR
Gameplay: 5/5
Itemization and customization 6/5
Exploration 4.5/5
Community: Passionate but extremely welcoming 5/5
Graphics 4/5 (Its really not that bad, in the swamps i understand but after thats its pretty good, the enemy and character models tho....)
OVERALL RATING 4.7/5 (Amazing)

185139180.review:
Игра - полное барахло. Как и типа дьяблоид Titan Quest. Все во что смогли разработчики - это графика ну и атмосфера, хотя тут не вижу проблемы, так как подобных высеров было дофига в подобном сеттинге, типа Jericho.
Баланс - дно. Разнообразие - полное дно. Некоторые локации как-будто скопированы с Titan Quest. Звуки - дно. Музыка - нудный отстой. Если напичкать героя всякими заклинаниями, то вообще крайне трудно понять что происходит на экране. С некоторыми противниками сражаться практически невозможно. Не понятно как получаешь урон и как его избежать. Звуки абсолютно неинформативные. В конце концов игра просто ужасно скучная. Пройти до конца немного не смог, так как задолбался очередного босса месить. Ближе к концу игры перестал считать собственные смерти. Было просто похрен. Удалил нахрен.
Вообщем всем, абсолютно всем, включая Blizzard по всей видимости уже никогда не превзойти Diablo 2.

185120435.review:
An hack n' slash which has the utmost respect for its player's time. While it has multiplayer, it is clear that is designed for a solo self-found playstyle. You do not have to play hundreds of hours to complete a build. This is an hack n' slash that, while it has an endgame, it also has a ''soft'' ceilling for your character. Some may not like it and prefer the infinite scaling of other of the genre. But, as someone who's game time is limited, i appreciate this approach. With no season structure i am not missing anything by playing the same character intermittently accross multiple years. 

The gameplay itself is very engaging. Skills and item descriptions can seem a little daunting at time for new players. But, once you focus on the stats that you need, it is not that complex. You will spend a while looking at stats, ability and passives in trying to understand how it would all fit in your build. 

In term of presentation, it is serviceable. The game has below average texture quality, even for its time. And the asthetic is kind of bland. It does not have as strong a personality as other games in the genre.

If you get it on sale, i recommend getting the two big expansion, ashes of malmouth and forgotten gods. Their additions will make your first time playthrough much more enjoyable.

185103330.review:
Especailly coming from PoE-2, this is amazing. Why? Because this is how loot is supposed to be. From the very beginning on you just get pounded with loot and it's amazing. Then there's really weird things like... more storage, easy and cheap re-spec, non-disappearing portals, and non-respawning enemies, no fodder enemies that can kill you, no flasks... and possibly the best part: every DLC combined is less than one backpack in PoE2 lol. 

I don't mean to have so much vitriol about PoE2 but it's just terrible as far as games like this go. And Grim Dawn is everything you'd want. Granted I don't have a ton of time in the game yet, but enough to know that I'm having way more fun with this. When you add that the game was a mere $2.50, it makes it all the better. I bought all DLC at full price to support it, personally. 

If there was anything I would change, it would be that green loot is better than yellow, and that's just a super weird choice. In every loot game you play its grey < green < blue < purple < yellow < orange... in this game it seems to be grey < yellow < green < blue < purple < (and possibly orange, not that far yet). I can't see any reason to do this except to make players think the loot they're getting is better than it really is due to years of programming.

Lastly, I wish there was more direction, and less maze-like connections between areas. Those also feel like they're done purely to slow you down, which never feels good. The game is big enough that it wouldn't make anyone play less if they could simply walk straight. But again... 500 times better than PoE2 who scrambles and resets the map when leaving the area, so if you portal to town and then gamble trying to get a usable piece of loot that's not 25 levels below your level for too long, and your portal disappears, have fun starting over.

Rating: 7.5/10 + Recommended

185055080.review:
If you’re into ARPGs, Grim Dawn is a solid pick, even after all these years. It’s got two expansions (and a third on the way), and honestly, there’s so much to do it’s almost overwhelming. You can start out on Normal, but flipping on the Veteran option makes it a lot more interesting once you’re used to how things work. And yeah, it’s super addictive - once you finish, you’ll probably want to dive back in with a new class or crank up the difficulty.

The world feels alive, with handcrafted maps that are actually fun to explore, a day-night cycle, weather, and even some verticality in the terrain. You can rotate the camera too, which is a nice touch. The multiclass system is awesome - there are so many combos to try out it’s kind of ridiculous. And the factions, the environmental storytelling, and how much actual “RPG” is baked into the quests and character-building? It’s all really well done.

Now, it’s not perfect. The damage types can feel like a lot at first (seriously, there are so many), and figuring out gear can get overwhelming. But once you get the hang of it, it’s not too bad. If you’re into summoner builds like me, you’re gonna love this—the pets here actually hold their own and feel really strong. It’s probably the most fun I’ve had with summons since Diablo 2.

Overall, Grim Dawn is just a really fun game. It’s not trying to be Path of Exile (which is actually a good thing for some people), and while it might feel a bit old-school, that’s part of its charm. If you like ARPGs with lots of replay value and build options, it’s definitely worth picking up - especially if it’s on sale (I bought it for a couple bucks with all DLC's). 

Give it a shot, you might get hooked.

This game is really boring honestly - I really liked it before it seemed like it had content and lore and random farm type gameplay but it kinda gets tedious and there's obviously alot of looking up guides on the internet in order to find the right steps or knowledge in order to understand gameplay elements - it's very easy to make a wrong step that you could only really know if you had intense knowledge about game mechanics - that's just not really well explained in game. 

It's very boring - It's very common that you'll go through a whole area and just destroy every enemy in one shot, and then there's an enemy at the end that requires 10 more levels in order to fight, that will one shot you and has 1 million times the health of every other enemy - 

The drops seem extraordinarily common, very little rare drops, and the rare drops you do seem to get drop very frequently with very little variation in benefit variance.. 

Things are just not explained in game, there's a website linked in-game to the guide page and I guess I could go look at it for a couple of hours to understand but ... really it should be easy to follow and explained in game right? 


I had weird black screen issues going in that would sabotage my gameplay - changing it to windowed mode seemed to fix it -

And honestly a big problem I have with it as a whole is that mainly everything, and quite possibly lore and content, like reading content, is completely skippable with no consequences, you can sell 99% of items you find and it seems like there's genuinely no consequence, like those items aren't really crucial or important, you'll always find some other mediocre item - So it's sort of bloated up with what I would call fake or facade-content that isn't really more indepth or something you can chew on or experiment with - lots of the lore and reading content is boring conversations that don't really do anything and aren't really important, much of the early dialogue is going over quests I already finished just by playing. 

So it's extremely linear and everything you are supposed to do is just in your path and you can already figure out what you need to do before you ever get the quest anyway because it's in your path.

The normal gameplay is completely too easy, except for some extreme difficulty curves that are very confusing - the first boss, krieg the warden, is very difficult, so I skipped him and went along another path and low-and-behold finished the next 20 quests and explorations that were supposed to come after him, too easily ..

I would not recommend this if you plan to play on Steam Deck.

184996936.review:
"Grim Dawn is a standout gem in the action RPG genre, and for many, it surpasses the legendary Diablo series in depth and content. This dark, gritty world is packed with lore, dangerous enemies, and an atmosphere that pulls you in from the very start. Its post-apocalyptic setting is rich with mystery and despair, creating a uniquely immersive experience.

One of Grim Dawn’s most impressive features is its dual-class system. Players can mix and match from multiple classes, creating unique builds that cater to their playstyle. The abilities are not only powerful but visually satisfying, with each skill feeling impactful and rewarding. This customization, paired with a deep devotion system and extensive loot, gives the game near-infinite replayability.

The story is another strong point. Told through well-written quests, lore notes, and choices that influence the world, it’s a tale of survival, betrayal, and hope. The narrative is supported by an atmospheric soundtrack that enhances every moment, from eerie exploration to intense battles.

Graphically, Grim Dawn may not rival modern AAA titles, but it makes up for it with detailed environments, atmospheric lighting, and a cohesive visual style. Each area is packed with personality, and the game’s design perfectly complements its grim and foreboding tone.

The sound design is also top-notch, from the clashing of weapons to the haunting ambient tracks. Together, they build a world that feels alive and engaging.

Grim Dawn excels in offering a content-rich experience. With countless quests, hidden areas, and secrets, it’s the kind of game where exploration is always rewarded. The endgame content is robust as well, with numerous challenges and a dynamic multiplayer mode for those seeking to team up with friends.

Whether you’re a veteran ARPG fan or new to the genre, Grim Dawn is an absolute must-play. Its depth, customization, and engaging story set it apart as one of the best in the genre. Prepare to lose countless hours in this dark, addictive adventure!"

184957446.review:
Спорный продукт. Есть как очень сильные стороны, так и очень слабые.
Ставлю отрицательную оценку, т.к. имхо слабых сторон больше. О них ниже.
85 часов – это на раз пробежать норму (75) и на абсолюте добежать до Чертополоха (10). На большее меня не хватило.
И, как прожженный фанат TQ, не могу оценивать GD, без оглядки на Титан. 

[h3]Понравилось[/h3]
[b]* Техничка[/b] – великолепно исполненная. Было взято все лучше из TQ и доработано до идеала. Вот несколько примеров того что тут есть, но не было в TQ: указано поглощение брони, указано как распределены шансы попадания по частям тела, указаны проценты вкаченные в резисты сверх лимита, расписаны все уроны и их проценты: физ, проникающий, огонь, яд, и пр, расписаны все уроны и резисты петов, сравнение урона оружия и много чего еще.
[b]* Удобство[/b] – полная поддержка геймпада которым реально удобно играть. Автоподбор вещей. Бесконечные бутылки красного и синего, которые всегда при тебе. Удобно складывающиеся компоненты в бесконечные стопки, которые теперь не разделены по сложностям как было в TQ и теперь не занимают так много места. Рецепты теперь достаточно изучить один раз и они всегда будут при тебе. В общем свели микроменеджмент до минимума.
[b]* Хорошая оптимизация.[/b] На моем калькуляторе отлично идет.
[b]* Доп. прокачка через созвездия[/b] – отличное подспорье к вариативности сборки билдов.

[h3]Не понравилось[/h3]
[b]* НЕИНТЕРЕСНО![/b] Сюжет? Можно сказать отсутствует. Лор тоже никакущий, записки и диалоги сплошной шизофазийный бред. Атмосферы нет. Все однообразно. Внутренний мир весь какой-то пресный и пластилиновый.
[b]* Легкость.[/b] TQ намного сложнее. Эту же игру на хардкоре можно пройти на изи. За 85 часов я своим первым персонажем умер только один раз в начале, и то по незнанию от окружения – от разлитого яда в пещере. Просто чтобы понимали: я на абсолюте стою в упор и без хилок отправляю в мир иной коменданта, ну это как вообще? Делайте выводы.
[b]* Тут придется пачками убивать людей.[/b] TQ себе такого не позволял (если не брать в расчет последнее дополнение).
[b]* Карта, с постоянными развилками.[/b] Жуть как раздражает – включаешь карту и на тебе 3-4 развилки в раз, идешь по первой, получаешь еще 3. Ну за***сь, спасибо на***уй.
[b]* Безликость вещей[/b], особенно реликвий. Тупо все на одно лицо – камушки с символами, вы серьезно?
[b]* Бои – сплошная каша.[/b] Что мобы, что боссы, все на одно лицо. Порой даже не видишь босса, с которым сражаешься из-за обилия спец эффектов.
[b]* Боссы.[/b] Безликие и не запоминающиеся. Разве что последний запомнился, и то с натяжкой.
[b]* Множество вещей[/b] – их тут прямо как из рага изобилия. Валится столько зеленки, а потом и синьки, что по итогу ценность и радость от найденных вещей сводится на нет. И в каждой вещи еще и целая портянка всяческих улучшений.

[hr][/hr]

[b]Итог[/b]: хороша в техническом плане, но с миром, который больше выглядит как песочница.

184898205.review:
[h2]О мрачном рассвете и радости побед![/h2]

[h2]📖 Сюжет[/h2]
Добро пожаловать в мир, где мрачнее только рассвет, а NPC на редкость угрюмы и брутальны. Игра начинается на эшафоте — а где ещё, собственно? Здесь вас ждут интриги, моральные дилеммы и уникальные персонажи. Позволить психу сжечь семью или поверить ведьме? Решайте сами!

[h2]🎵 Музыка[/h2]
Атмосфера дополнена готической, но временами тревожной музыкой. Особенно выделяется тема топей — идеальный саундтрек для размышлений о вечном... и о том, какой билд выбрать.

[h2]🎮 Геймплей[/h2]
Игра предлагает гибкость в создании персонажа: можно комбинировать классы, прокачивать навыки через систему набожности и лутать горы эпиков. Боевка — неспешная и тактическая, напоминает Soulslike-игры. Даже рядовые мобы могут преподнести сюрпризы.

[h2]🏗️ Мир[/h2]
Исследование мира — отдельный кайф. Здесь полно секретов: ломайте стены, взрывайте завалы, и тайные локации раскроются.

[h2]💡 Итог[/h2]
[b]"Grim Dawn"[/b] — игра, где апокалипсис обрел свой мрачный шарм 😈 Если хотите игру, которая затянет на очень много часов и даст возможность  проникнуться хтонью в мрачном мире, "Grim Dawn" вас не разочарует. Входите в состояние потока, исследуйте, экспериментируйте с умениями, и наслаждайтесь готической красотой. Рекомендую всем — от любителей "Диабло" до поклонников "Пути изгнания"! 😊 Классическая ARPG, но в очень качественном исполнении. После неё не захочется обратно в Titan Quest.

184897791.review:
Grim Dawn is a wonderful Action RPG that is gritty, challenging, deep, and engaging.  Even just playing the base game, players are rewarded with many places to visit, quests to complete, and a satisfying number of interwoven, apocalyptic stories to unravel.  Grim Dawn presents many compelling mysteries in ways rarely seen in ARPG games, and patient players will be rewarded for exploration with great regularity.

In addition, the overlapping of two selected classes in order to create new synergies is compelling in much the same way it was when the concept was first presented in Titan Quest, and players of that game will find a lot to like in this one as well.  And so, if you appreciate detailed ARPGs that present several un-lockable difficulty settings, then you should try Grim Dawn; it might just be right for you.

184893186.review:
The very best Diablo-like there is, especially if you're more of a solo self-found kind of person and don't care much for live service/league-oriented sorts of things. The balance and viability of a wide variety of builds is top-notch. And it's a game that's largely meant to be played, finished, and then start a new character. Although there are plenty of optional end-game activities for those who want to really optimize and challenge their build.

Devs are passionate and transparent and don't get carried away trying to re-invent the wheel. And they're still updating the game 8 years after release, including a new DLC coming sometime this year.

Above all, this game is for people who just want to sit down, play a video game, and not get too bogged down with things that aren't related to smashing monsters and wearing magical armor, although the story and dialogue are very well-liked and unique in the genre, but entirely skippable if you're not into the whole reading thing.

184883038.review:
Awesome game. I love ARPGs and Grim Dawn is a super unique take on the genre. The story is compelling and the choices you make have pretty cool impacts on the world. Despite the age of the engine (it's from Titan Quest), everything feels super smooth and attacks are easily discernable and telegraphed well. All the skills feel fluid and unique and by and large it's pretty well balanced too. I was able to beat Ultimate Hardcore with just about most skills in the game that I found enjoyable.

My only complaint is the lack of a real endgame beyond Shattered Realm and I hope that is addressed with either the second game or an expansion. I don't know what that would look like, but i'd like to see something a little more involved than SR as character builds only really come together around 94 once you are able to put on proper equipment which is a shame because thats about the time you finish the story.

This game is also easily moddable as well and there are plenty of mods out there. Some are minor balance changes or graphical changes, and others do things like remake the entirety of diablo 2 within the game. Theres one in particular that adds live service multiplayer similar to PoE but SSF called Grim League, which also adds more endgame content to the game which I highly recommend.

Truly genius, worth a buy at full price but especially worth it on the current sale of about 30$ for everything.

I got this game because I heard good things about it as an ARPG, that it's one of the better ones in the genre, and I wanted to try it out.
In the end, I found it to be really lackluster. It failed to interest me mechanically, narratively, graphically. Unchallenging on Veteran. I don't know why I played it for so long and expected it to get less boring.

GAMEPLAY + MECHANICS:
The crux of the gameplay is basically just optimization: make a build, craft your gear to fit it. The main problem is that this is one or two button gameplay, a boring faceroll contest between you and waves of cannon fodder. The randomly-generated loot was worse than my current gear 90% of the time and the only noteworthy items were unique/crafted. The lack of information restriction on the Devotions made it very overwhelming to view initially, and it took a fair bit of time to look and plan out my build. May as well just be playing with a spreadsheet for all the fun it is.

Lots of visual noise in combat so there's a solid chance that, upon death, you might not be able to distinguish what actually killed you. Generally, you will spend your time destroying waves of hopelessly incompetent trash and then get into a slap fight with a single strong boss. I only felt cool when I got to later content which was more visually appealing.

The main draw I can see this having is just all the numberplay and loot rolling; it was neat to stack a bunch of buffs and effects into having a really stupidly strong build going, but in the end I was still just clicking on stuff, watching it near instantly die, and occasionally using an ability. A lot of damage types are just flavor to suit certain builds and classes, and to diversify the numbers a bit. Having two classes is what opens up character progression and customization options the most, but in the end it seems to just loop back into making your numbers go up, and I found it really unengaging. 

VISUALS + STORY:
The tone is grim a la Diablo but with a faint Victorian/Western twist to it. Doesn't really distinguish itself enough from its competitors enough to be interesting.
About half of the game is visually bland when not ugly, and the audio failed to impress. Kind of irritated me how much of the gear literally looked like junk, and the whole "iron is more valuable than gold" spiel falls flat fast when you begin to drown in metals a few hours in (like why have the flavor text be so measurably incorrect).

Not sure where the RPG part comes into play. Probably a misnomer, as is common in 'RPG' games. Nothing of value in terms of roleplay.

All-in-all, this is... a Diablo-adjacent ARPG. I'm not sure why I expected something different, but I did expect to get some enjoyment out of it. I was disappointed.

184735019.review:
So, now that I've played Path of Exile 2 for a month, here are just a few of the major things I like about this game more than Path of Exile 1&2 (I won't mention Diablo 4 because I feel like I wasted $70 dollars on that trash and have had it uninstalled since 3 weeks after it released) that make it LESS addictive but MORE fun in my opinion (this is both a good and bad thing in and of itself) as well as things that are probably holding it back from becoming a name brand such as Path of Exile, Diablo, etc:

- Secret Areas: Similar to the hidden areas in Aspirant's Trial in POE1, Grim Dawn has many areas that are only accessible by searching walls for breakable spots, hitting a hidden lever or button, etc. This adds to the feel of exploration that the ARPG genre is lacking with the normalization of procedural generated level design. I have not even really beaten the game to the peak of the end game content yet and each time I make a new character, I find new areas that engage with my sense of wonder about the game's depth at such a low file size compared to other major titles. Grim Dawn is a love-letter to gamers from gamers which make up the developer.

- NO DRM: You live in a world where you buy a $70 title and 4 years later think to yourself, "Man, I kind of want to play that game again!" So you go about searching on how to install it so you can enjoy it once again only to find out that the game's servers have been taken offline by the game developer and the only way to play the game that you bought for the price of a month's cell phone bill is to illegally pirate the game. This means that even though you PAID for the game, you are forced to technically commit a crime in order to utilize your purchase. This is a HUGE problem in gaming these days. There have been a multitude of instances that a game's community has found a way to crack or mod the game in order to play without DRM to keep the game alive in it's vanilla state or even update/improve the game in some way only to have the game's developer SUE the community to remove this ability. Rockstar Games, for example took GTA3's servers offline a few years ago even though there was a very dedicated, albeit small, community of players that still enjoyed the game. The community did two things: Requested the source code from Rockstar in order to mod the game for play without DRM as well as started working on graphical upgrades that could bring in a wider audience. They didn't ask for money for this, but that didn't stop Rockstar from first denying the request and putting out a cease and desist order threatening the community from working on either of the things mentioned above. This is one example but many exist from nearly every major game studio from THQ to Bethesda. There is another aspect to this that also destroyed the gaming experience of my childhood, offline co-op play. Since you have to connect to the studio's servers for nearly every game you play now, you cannot have the offline co-op play or LAN parties that I enjoyed from my childhood on Counter-Strike 1.5 for example. You HAVE to have internet access and HAVE to connect to the server in order to utilize your purchase. I honestly don't know how this is legal since they are basically stealing your money if they stop offering the ability to play the game you bought, but here we are. Grim Dawn lets you play offline, with no DRM.

- DIVERSE and BALANCED builds: Nearly ever skill in Grim Dawn is viable to create a build. You don't need to follow a guide on what is META to have access to later content like in Path of Exile 1 (and to a much larger extent in Path of Exile 2.) Instead of spending hours theory crafting in Path of Building or mobalytics in order to see if an idea you have will be able to scale enough to beat Uber Elder or farm T17 maps (or even get past T1 waystones in Path of Exile 2,) you just pick which abilities you enjoy and then go about customizing them with gear add-ons or interactions within the wide-ranging class choices. You can be a thorns spell caster or a gun-slinging summoner and you are not backed into a corner because you are afraid that after 20 hours you'll find that your skills are worthless after a point in the game. This allows true player choice and is very refreshing in the face of near mandatory build specificity of POE. Grim Dawn is a gem in a field of dirt in this regard.
- After nearly a decade now (over if you include Early Access) content is still being put out by the developer and on that note the developer actually allows the community to mod the game for seasonal content: As previously stated, the fact that you can buy a game and come back after a few years only to have your purchase be completely voided save for the real money you spent, Grim Dawn not only keeps updating the game with more fine-tuned balance, bug fixes, and content such as DLC, but has allowed if not encouraged the community to mod and improve upon the base game to allow seasonal content updates and complete modification to the point that it is a different game altogether.
- NO MICROTRANSACTIONS: The only money you will spend will be for the base game and the DLCs, no lootboxes, skins, or pay to win. This is a breath of fresh air in the current video game world we live in where you spend $70 dollars for a game only to then have to engage with the in-game shop that will allow you to actually have fun in the game (Path of Exile's stash tabs are a lesser egregious example of this because it's free, but still an example nonetheless.)  
- Only 5GB!!!!!: The entire base game as well as all the DLC can fit on a mid-grade hard-drive from 2001. This is in stark contrast to many other titles that require a fairly percentage of a 1TB storage device's memory to install. This has the beneficial add-on effect of allowing near instantaneous loading of new areas as the data required to load into the areas is very small compared to modern-gaming PCs very minimum RAM specifications. It also allows for nearly zero strain on your hardware. 
Now on to areas which may feel off-putting to more modern audiences but I don't mind at all and actually gives is a plus to me:
- Linear Game Play: Since there is no procedural generated layouts, once you explore the area that's it. There's no continuing to explore the same area over and over again in order to complete an objective or get to a boss. You can redo an area of course but your map will still have every part of the area explored. Some will feel it is monotonous whereas I have the opposite opinion and feel that exploring the same area over and over again only artificially adds to the time you are playing and offers no real benefit to the player. 
- Graphics were old back when it launched a decade ago, they are ancient now: Crate Entertainment bought the Titan Quest game engine from Iron Lore Entertainment when that developer went under. This means that the engine the game is built on is over 20 years old and there is almost no possibility for a major graphical update without a re-release of the game which will probably never happen. Again, I don't mind this and think not only gives a certain charm to the game but also allows for that previously mentioned (comparatively) extremely small filesize and fantastic ability to run on even very-out-of-date hardware. Many modern audiences however probably are turned-off by the ancient graphics quality you'd find on a later Playstation 2 title. 
- No Psychological Effect: While not many people talk about this, nearly every game studio from Triple-A to larger indie ones either employ Psychologists or employ research done by them in order to trigger a psychologically addictive response in their titles to get player retention (so you can continuously spend money in the in-game store.) From microtransactions to artificially inflated times for enemy spawns, to stealth nerfs of mechanics that allow you to progress faster, this is everywhere in modern games.

Grim Dawn

184726503.review:
Game starts out OK, but becomes quickly repetitive and grindy, and ultimately tedious, with the state of the game reset (in terms of enemies killed) every time you exit and restart. 

There is little enough sense of ultimate narrative purpose as it is, and any sense of progression within the narrative is defeated when the player forced to grind their way, yet again, through already well explored areas just to return to whatever challenge they had left incomplete when last playing.  The only workaround seems to be to never exit the game - which is hardly a practical solution for those who use their computers for other things.

Multiplayer is also a bit of disaster - when it does not trigger a black screen, it is impossible for the public to actually play on ANY of the supposedly 'open' servers.  
Despite their declared open status, apparently (according to the GD forums) the online player culture is such that only friends of the host are typically ever welcome to play on them - all others attempting to join are simply banned immediately, with no reason given.  

In fairness this seems to be a product of a reportedly toxic player community rather than a software issue - though I would have thought that the developers would by now have recognised the impact such behaviour has on perceptions of the GD experience and designed a way around it, or at least instantiated a policy preventing such rudeness. 

Bottom line is that anyone hosting a declared 'public' game server using this software should actually welcome the public as a condition of use.  Hosts who want only their own friends to join can easily use a password to make their server private.

184694518.review:
首先,选了中文要点确定,才会变中文界面.其次,要先建角色,建了之后重启游戏,才能看见新建角色,才能开始游戏.最后,地图很大,要随时按L放传送门,以免跑尸太费时间.最后的最后,加移速和照亮的装备/镶嵌物很有用

持续可玩性为0,中后期就是垃圾时间.
地图整体比较大,比较绕,越到后期越明显.并且地图标示不明确,很多重要出入口没有明显标示,不找到跟前是看不出来的.甚至在重要的地方,比如挑战图和冥神图里,是不能放传送门的.挑战图作为死亡的惩罚机制,不能回头还勉强可以接受.但是冥神图不让放传送门,而且出入口非常不明显,甚至只能闷头打通或者死亡才能出来,在黑咕隆咚的地区寻找出入口,简直就是折磨!
而且,整体照明手段非常缺乏!如此暗黑设定的游戏,竟然没有专门的照明技能或者物品.只能从装备中获得及其有限的照明手段.在我好不容易攒到三件带照明的装备后,一共加了125%照明范围,对视野的帮助仍然及其有限!在漆黑的及其危险的最终地图冥神图里,简直就是对眼睛的折磨!玩2天以后眼睛都快瞎了!
还有更难以容忍的一点,是没有详细的任务文本.也就是说,在接任务时,你一定要仔仔细细记住每个任务的地点,如果你积累了几个任务,却忘了到哪里完成,那么,这个游戏就结束了!因为你没有任何手段去查看详细文本,或许你还能找到发任务的NPC,但在中后期好几个主城的情况下,你根本找不到哪个NPC了,甚至完成任务后你也有可能找不到交任务的NPC了,因为有时候NPC可能在野外.右边及其有限的任务提示,真的帮不上什么大忙.而且,有时候任务地点明确,地图也标示了,但是偏偏你搜遍整个地图,也找不到任务物品或任务NPC!所以,在中后期,你只能看着右边完全不知道去哪里做的任务提示,像无头苍蝇似的满地图乱撞.
最后,材料掉落也是没有任何提示的,比如冥神之血是制作挑战钥匙的必要材料,但是没有任何提示告诉你该去哪里获得.除非你第一次打到的时候就把地点记在小本本上.否则为了几个材料,你可能又要像无头苍蝇似的满地图乱撞.

184689984.review:
The dual-class system is the heart of Grim Dawn, a crossroads of power and identity. You don’t just play Grim Dawn; you compose it. A symphony of abilities, stats, and decisions that crescendos into something uniquely yours. Each build is a new verse in the hymn of your journey.

And that hymn? It’s old, familiar, but not tired. Grim Dawn sings it anew—a melody of choices and consequences. The ashes of Cairn are steeped in stories of ruin and resilience, of dark powers wrestled into submission and wielded with trembling hands. You are both savior and destroyer, a figure caught in the paradox of creation and decay.

The base game lies behind me, a conquered expanse of ruins and revelations. But ahead—two expansions, their gates yawning open like the maw of the unknown. 

It's time to continue.
