Grim dawn - это MMORPG с мрачной атмосферой,  которая может занять несколько сотен часов вашего времени. Чего только стоит изучение классов и навыков. Также пару новых классов появляются в dlc. А сколько времени может уйти, если вы решите полностью изучить созвездия набожности.

Однозначно советую любителям MMORPG.

183619052.review:
Wow! What an amazing game! I've never really played this style of ARPG before but my god what a thrilling and captivating game so far! The atmosphere is spectacular, the combat is simple enough to learn but still creates enough of a challenge where each scenario requires strategy and planning. The story so far is fun and voice acting is great, and again I can't get over how beautiful this game is!

 I've spent a long time looking for an RPG with a compelling story, in depth and vast lore, cool creatures and monsters, while still giving off the true RPG vibe in the sense the player has control of outcomes and questlines. Something that's seems simple at first glance but is truly endless and infinite in its replayability. If that is the sort of game you're looking for, Grim Dawn is that game! And it only takes up 5 GB of storage (pre-dlc) which is an absolute steal for the amount of content you're getting. Take advtantage of the 90% off sale no matter who you are because you will not be disappointed. Even at full price this game is worth it. Which is hard to say about most modern games, goes to show the passion and love that was put into this game!

English Version:

The game is really good, seriously you have to give it a chance even if you think this type of game won't appeal to you... believe me, you'll like this one, and it's very addictive. I've been playing for hours and hours without realizing it.
1) The graphics are decent, nothing out of this world (hopefully they improve the graphics).
2) The gameplay is good on PC; you only need keys to launch attacks, but not to move, you do that with the mouse.
3) The whole game is designed so you don't have to move the camera, and if you want to, you can, but it's not necessary.
4) You can level up quickly in the game.
5) Unlike other games, this one is very easy to understand, meaning the learning logistics are very quick. This allows you to focus on enjoying the game instead of spending hours learning how to play.
6) The campaign mode is very, very entertaining with many hours of gameplay. If you don't want to play PvP, you don't have to.
7) The most complicated thing might be understanding the items in the game, how to take advantage of them... but little by little, you get it. Even so, it's not necessary to be an expert in the many metrics within the game between items and character... just understanding them superficially is enough.

I highly recommend buying this game to support its developers, even if it's just the base game.

FOR THE DEVELOPMENT TEAM: Improve the graphics of the entire game and the combat effects, since there is an option to play in "Ultra quality" that should at least be noticeable so we can appreciate that great graphic quality for those of us who enjoy the visual aspect.

183605667.review:
Beware, the store page of this game claims Full Controller Support and a Playable rating.

This is a lie. 

This Game has partially working controller support at best. 
This game was not made for controllers in mind. 
The developers hacked a barely functioning alpha version into the game a couple of years after release and never iterated on it.
Crate Entertainment is clearly not interested in controller users. This is completely legitimate, it is their business decision.

What is not acceptable is the plainly wrong 'Full Controller Support' tag here on Steam by Valve and the 'Playable' rating that goes along with it.

You will not be able to play this game on the Steam Deck (unless you connect an external mouse/keyboard).

The Playable rating is undeserved and it should be downgraded Unsupported and the 'Full Controller Support' should be downgraded to 'Partial Controller Support'.

183554970.review:
It's been said a lot at this point, but Grim Dawn really does feel almost like the true spiritual successor to Diablo 2. I love the set pieces within its environments, the level design and sense of continuous gradual exploration uncovering the secrets, plot twists & the history of its world, and Grim Dawn has some of the best writing/storytelling in pretty much any ARPG out there even to this day. 
The soundtrack is great, the bosses and skill trees and systems within the game are fun and in-depth, and the developers are still active providing the community updates with commonly requested features and addressing bug fixes even well after 7-8 years past release. We're also going to be getting an entirely *new* expansion later in 2025 with a new zone, storyline, and class! There is a lot of love and passion for the genre being put on display by the devs that's evident here and a shocking lack of greed being shown here too. This is *not* a ladder-climbing, season-pass chasing, competitive always-online ARPG -- Grim Dawn is meant to be enjoyed for its' core mechanics, narrative and level design rather than online balancing/trading that's commonplace in most ARPGs these days and I appreciate that very much, and much prefer playing the game solo as well. 

It is a bit dated on the graphics front due to a smaller team and budget compared to its competition, but as far as any visual downsides go I personally think the vanilla game looks fine as-is to this day and has a charming enough art style. Regardless, I would still highly recommend checking out GrimTex mods (Nexus) and other various reshade/texture mods on Crate's forums or on Nexus for the sake of curiosity. 

Generally, for most if not essentially all of the systems within the game, the mod support for this game is fantastic! You can add custom bosses, environments, classes, quests, tweak systems within the game and so much more -- the level of freedom and agency Crate Entertainment has provided Grim Dawn's players with here is awesome.

You can commonly find Grim Dawn and its expansions on sale, with the base game going as low as like, $3 bucks a lot of the time. The expansions also are *very* worthwhile! There's really no excuse not to try it out if you have previous experience with ARPGs, or have been wanting to try out an ARPG for the first time. As a bonus, it's *extremely* Steam Deck-friendly, speaking from experience. You might just have to mess with a couple of controller setting tweaks to change the trackpads to register as a mouse in the Steam Controller Settings (also check the GD and/or Steam Deck reddit for tips!) but you'll be good to go in to time. I love this game!

183539021.review:
[h1]An Epic ARPG Experience - Grim Dawn Shines Bright![/h1]

[b]Review:[/b]
Grim Dawn is a masterclass in the action RPG genre, offering an incredibly rich and immersive experience. From the moment you step into the dark, foreboding world of Cairn, you're greeted with stunning visuals, atmospheric sound design, and a narrative that pulls you in with its depth and intrigue.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
The game excels in providing a fluid and satisfying combat system, with a wide array of character classes and skill combinations that cater to every playstyle. The dual-class system is a brilliant feature, allowing for unprecedented customization and replayability. Whether you're a seasoned ARPG veteran or a newcomer to the genre, Grim Dawn's gameplay mechanics are intuitive yet deep enough to keep you hooked for hours.

[b]Content:[/b]
One of Grim Dawn's strongest points is its sheer amount of content. The base game alone is packed with quests, secrets, and lore-rich environments. Add to this the expansions, and you're looking at a world brimming with adventures waiting to be explored. The developers at Crate Entertainment have done a phenomenal job in continually updating the game with new features, improvements, and community-driven content.

[b]Atmosphere:[/b]
The dark and gritty atmosphere of Grim Dawn is unmatched. The detailed environments, from desolate wastelands to haunted forests, are beautifully crafted and create an engaging world that feels alive and dynamic. The soundtracks and voice acting further enhance the immersion, making every moment spent in Cairn memorable.

[b]Community and Support:[/b]
The community around Grim Dawn is active and welcoming. With robust modding support, players have crafted countless mods that add new layers of excitement and creativity to the game. The developers are responsive and dedicated, consistently delivering updates and listening to player feedback.

In conclusion, Grim Dawn is a must-play for any action RPG fan. It delivers a stellar combination of engaging gameplay, rich storytelling, and an ever-evolving world. If you're looking for a game that offers endless hours of enjoyment and a truly epic adventure, Grim Dawn is the perfect choice. 

Rating: ★★★★★
